intro: Brachystemum lanceolatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf brachystemum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Poaceae. It is a perennial grass that typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. The plant features slender, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It is characterized by its robust root system and ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Brachystemum lanceolatum plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
